Element.Goal: To maintain the FPSO position and provide reliable connection to flow lines. The system must enable the FPSO to weathervane and to withstand all design environmental conditions sufficiently to maintain riser and umbilical integrity
Element.Name: Turret mooring system

SubElement.Name: Turret Swivel Support Structure (Inner Support Structure)

FunctionalRequirement.Criteria: Offsets during single and double line failure shall not cause the risers to fail and interference between riser and mooring shall be avoided
FunctionalRequirement.Function: To maintain the FPSO position

FunctionalRequirement.Criteria: The mooring system shall be designed to remain connected all year round and through all the ranges of Metocean data specified.
FunctionalRequirement.Function: To provide reliable connection to flow lines
The FPSO shall be freely weathervaning using a passive turret mooring system, with the turret located in front of product tanks.
The position, angle and tension of each mooring line shall be monitored and recorded. Alarms shall be raised in the CCR in the event of design operating limitations being exceeded
Turret structure (outerwall) shall withstand design explosion load with adequate explosion load relief method
TMS shall be disconnectable in a reliable manner to allow FPSO to leave upon extreme environment

Element.Goal: To monitor vessel actvities and provide adequate information to prevent collisio and navigational aide for vessels and helicopter
Element.Name: Ship collision avoidance & navigation aid

SubElement.Boundary: Visual Signal System (Navigation Aid System and Warning Light)
SubElement.Name: Visual Signal System (Navigation Aid System and Warning Light)

FunctionalRequirement.Criteria: The system shall present vessel movements on graphics that are based on marine charts. The system shall provide the facility to track and identify the vessels, initiate alarms should the vessels enter pre-defined exclusion zones or be on course that would in any way present a risk to the installation or the operation in the proximity of the platform. The information from the tracking system may be integrated with data from other installations and made available to other agencies. As such the system shall have the capability to store and hand off the data.
FunctionalRequirement.Function: There shall be a collision monitoring system able to detect a vessel on collision course.

FunctionalRequirement.Criteria: The radar system shall be able to register the course and speed of the object, and plotting facilities shall be included, e.g. automatic radar, plotting aid. Radar signals shall be transmitted to unit responsible for surveillance. The RADAR system shall be interfaced with 'StatoilHydro Surveillance RADAR system' (Statoil Marine VTS)
FunctionalRequirement.Function: To register the course and speed of the object

FunctionalRequirement.Criteria: A Differential Global Positioning System (DGPS) shall provide accurate positional information to various systems
FunctionalRequirement.Function: To provide exact location of RUBY FPSO for vessels to avoid collision course

FunctionalRequirement.Criteria:
Two (2) complete sets of radar shall be provided, with long range (S band) and accuracy (X band) features fitted with automatic radar plotting aids (ARPA) and interfaced with Gyrocompass, Automatic Identification system (AIS), DGPS systems to provide trajectory predictions and collision avoidance alerts for safety marine operation.
- The radars shall display in the radio room and Offloading Control Room
- The radar shall give all round coverage around the FPSO with minimum blind sector allowed by classification rules, and with a detection distance of 30 nautical Miles from the FPSO.
- Radar antennas shall be separated and placed to prevent any shadow effect.
- Radars components shall comply with Electromagnetic Compatibility Regulations
- The radar shall detect crafts 5-10 nm (not less than 5 nm)
FunctionalRequirement.Function: To provide interfaces between RADAR and other systems to provide trajectory predictions and collision avoidance alerts for safety marine operation.

FunctionalRequirement.Criteria: Compliance to Class rule and Tech specification
FunctionalRequirement.Function: To ensure communication with other vessels, helicopter pilots and onshore control statoins

FunctionalRequirement.Criteria: Shuttle tanker positioning system ... accuracy? warning upon proximity?
FunctionalRequirement.Function: To monitor the positon of the shuttle tanker

FunctionalRequirement.Criteria: Class rule / Available upon a single failure
FunctionalRequirement.Function: To provide visual signal for navigational aid in a reliable manner

Element.Goal: To provide a safe landing and take off area for helicopter operation
Element.Name: Helideck

FunctionalRequirement.Assurance:
- UK CAP 437 “Standards for offshore helicopter landing areas” 8th edition, 2016
- ICAO Annex 14 volume 2 “Aerodromes - Heliports” 4th edition, 2013
- DGCA section 4 series B part 3 “Heliports” revision 4, 2018
- DGCA Joint SOP “Night medical evacuation operation(Helicopters offshore)” revision 0, 2018
FunctionalRequirement.Criteria: The Helideck strength shall comply with CAP 437, CAAP 92-2 and AMSA Marine orders parts 12,14,17 and 60 and shall be suitable for the largest helicopter anticipated to be used at the RUBY FPSO.
FunctionalRequirement.Function: Helideck structure shall be capable, for the duration of the operational life of the platform, of providing structural support that accommodates the relevant helicopter operations ensuring stability under all foreseeable operational, environmental conditions. Super Puma AS332L2

FunctionalRequirement.Criteria: The Helideck shall be capable of withstanding heavy normal landing and emergency landing as specified in CAP 437, based on the largest helicopter anticipated to be used at the RUBY FPSO.
FunctionalRequirement.Function: To withstand impact load

FunctionalRequirement.Criteria: Three(3) access points(120 degrees between each access point) shall be arranged to escape upwind and removable or collapsible handrail will be arranged where exceeding the height limitation.
FunctionalRequirement.Function: To provide three (3) access points

FunctionalRequirement.Criteria:
Flush type tie-down point shall be provided on helideck surface of landing area and parking area. Drain pipe shall be fitted to each tie down point and shall be connected to gutter drain line.
One (1) set of illuminated windsock and supporting post shall be provided. Supporting post shall be provided with means of access for maintenance of windsock and light.
Glide path indicator(GPI)/Helicopter approach path indicator(HAPI) for day and night medevac shall be provided
FunctionalRequirement.Function: To provide navigational aids

Element.Goal:
The ballast water system shall provide easy and reliable facilities for ballast water distribution in order to maintain control of the floating offshore installation during routine operations and emergency situations, in terms of stability, heel, trim and draft and ensuring that hull stresses do not exceed the design strength criteria.  
The bilge system shall provide easy and reliable facilities for pumping from and draining watertight compartments.
Element.Name: Ballast and bilge system - based on Goliat FPSO

SubElement.Name: Ballast Water Tank, Vent and Level Monitoring
Emergency Bilge Suction (connected to Main Cooling S.W. Pump in E/R)

FunctionalRequirement.Criteria: The capacity of the ballast system shall also comply with §11 of the NMD Ballast regulations.
FunctionalRequirement.Function:
To maintain heel, trim and hull girder loads within normal operating limits and to
prevent severe weather bow emergence and re-entry slamming at light drafts without recourse to emergency ballasting of cargo or slops tanks

FunctionalRequirement.Criteria: The ballast system shall be equipped with at least two independent pumps.
FunctionalRequirement.Function: To maintain ballasting in the event of failure of one pump

FunctionalRequirement.Criteria: The ballast system shall be arranged with cross connections ensuring that ballast water can be cross fed from one side of the vessel to the other as a contingency measure.
FunctionalRequirement.Function: To cross-feed ballast water from one side of the vessel to the other

FunctionalRequirement.Criteria: Ballast system valves shall be designed fail-to-close
FunctionalRequirement.Function: To provide fail-safe function for the ballast valves

FunctionalRequirement.Criteria: An effective bilge system shall be provided for draining watertight compartments, e.g. primary bilge pump and emergency bilge pump.
FunctionalRequirement.Function: To drain watertight compartments
